Description: The Department of Financial Services fined Arch Insurance Company $1 million and National Union Fire Insurance Company $1.2 million and ordered the insurers to provide a combined $8 million in retroactive rebates for violations of New York Insurance Law following an investigation that found both insurers failed to satisfy required minimum loss ratio standards in blanket accident and health insurance policies issued to hundreds of New York volunteer firefighter districts, departments and companies. The announcement did not indicate how much each company would pay in rebates. Here we assume the total was equally divided between them.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Info Source: Division of Workers' Compensation Announces October Enforcement Actions, Targeted News Service, November 10, 2010 (via Nexis).

Description: Fine levied for issuing a policy form to Washington residents that was not filed with and approved by the Commissioner; failing to deliver a policy to Washington residents within a reasonable period of time after its issued. RCW 48.18.100; RCW 48.18.260; RCW 48.05.185; WAC 284-30-580
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Arch Insurance agreed to make a $1.017 million administrative payment to a group of states as part of the resolution of issues raised during an examination of its market conduct relating to travel insurance.
$10,000 fine levied for using incorrect rating factors on 62 policies; the Company violated RCW 48.19.040(6) and failing to include required forms in 60 policies.
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
